definition: to suspect everyone/overly suspicious
to doubt/to suspect
God/abbr. for 神舟[Shen2 zhou1]
deity/soul/spirit/unusual/mysterious/lively/expressive/expression/look/CL:個|个[ge4]/(slang) awesome/amazing
to doubt/to suspect
ghost/demon/terrible/damnable/clever/sly/crafty/(suffix for sb with a certain vice or addiction etc)/one of the 28 constellations

sentences.english: This idiom indicates a condition of being over suspicious bringing trouble on oneself.
sentences.chinese: 這個成語比喻疑神疑鬼，自相驚擾。

sentences.english: To say that people are skeptical is the grossest understatement.
sentences.chinese: 說人們疑神疑鬼已經是輕描淡寫啦。

sentences.english: She will not be suspicious and never limited your freedom.
sentences.chinese: 而且她既不會疑神疑鬼，也不會限制你的自由。

sentences.english: The suspicion of Procris is always harmful to teamwork.
sentences.chinese: 對於人與人之間的合作，疑神疑鬼總是有害。

definition: jumpy/nervous/oversensitive
mistrustful/suspicious/paranoid
to suspect/to have misgivings/suspicious/misgivings
to worry about personal gains and losses
suspicion/to suspect
to indulge in flights of fancy (idiom)/to let one's imagination run wild
to feel ill at ease
lit. every tree or bush an enemy soldier (idiom); fig. to panic and treat everyone as an enemy/to feel beleaguered
to have secret motives/to have a guilty conscience
lit. to see a bow reflected in a cup as a snake (idiom); fig. unnecessary suspicions/overly fearful
to be on tenterhooks (idiom)/to be anxious and frightened
to be preoccupied (idiom)/to be inattentive/to be frightened out of one's mind
(saying) to be very scared and on edge
man of Qǐ fears the sky falling (idiom); groundless fears
lit. agitated sitting or standing (idiom)/restless/fidgety
lacking in confidence/diffident/to have a guilty conscience
